entry.title: Android Dynamic Code Loading Restriction Vulnerability
entry.content:
æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Android Dynamic Code Loading Restriction Vulnerability

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™ç»•è¿‡

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸­å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š åœ¨Android 15ï¼ˆSDK 35ï¼‰ä¸Šï¼Œä½¿ç”¨Pixel 6æ‰‹æœºåˆ›å»ºå¹¶è¿è¡Œä¸€ä¸ªæ¶æ„çš„.apkæ–‡ä»¶æ—¶ï¼Œç”±äºAndroid 14å¼•å…¥çš„åŠ¨æ€ä»£ç åŠ è½½é™åˆ¶ï¼Œå¯¼è‡´Meterpreterä¼šè¯åœ¨é˜¶æ®µå‘é€åå¤±è´¥ã€‚è¿™è¡¨æ˜å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªæƒé™ç»•è¿‡é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå¯èƒ½é€šè¿‡File.setReadOnly()è¿›è¡Œå‘åå…¼å®¹çš„ä¿®å¤ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Google

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Android

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 15 (SDK 35)

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/issues/20294

ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues

Steps to reproduce

Using a Pixel 6 phone running Android 15 (SDK 35).
Created a payload .apk with

I expect this is due to restrictions around dynamic code loading added in Android 14 (https://developer.android.com/about/versions/14/behavior-changes-14?utm_source=chatgpt.com#safer-dynamic-code-loading). I think there is an easy backwards-compatible fix with File.setReadOnly() so I will try to send a PR.

Expected behavior

Stage sends / is run successfully and full Meterpreter session is opened.

Current behavior

Phone logs showing code loading error:

Sessions are opening but fail when stage times out:

Metasploit version

Framework: 6.4.55-dev-
Console : 6.4.55-dev-

Description:

Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services) contains a remote code execution caused by specially crafted requests sent over RDP by unauthenticated attackers, letting remote attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires network access to RDP port.

Severity: Critical

KEV: True

Shodan Query: cpe:"cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š æƒé™æå‡

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š WordPress Spreadsheet Price Changer for WooCommerce and WP E-commerce â€“ Light Plugin 2.4.37åŠæ›´æ—©ç‰ˆæœ¬å­˜åœ¨æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ï¼Œæœªç»è®¤è¯çš„æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´åˆ›å»ºç®¡ç†å‘˜çº§åˆ«çš„è´¦æˆ·ï¼Œä»è€Œå®Œå…¨æ§åˆ¶WordPressç½‘ç«™ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š WordPress

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Spreadsheet Price Changer for WooCommerce and WP E-commerce â€“ Light

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š <= 2.4.37

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/Nxploited/CVE-2025-48129

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ğŸš¨ CVE-2025-48129 - Privilege Escalation in WordPress Spreadsheet Price Changer Plugin

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Vulnerability Summary

  • Plugin Affected: Spreadsheet Price Changer for WooCommerce and WP E-commerce â€“ Light
  • Vulnerable Versions: <= 2.4.37
  • Patched Version: âŒ No official fix available
  • Discovered By: Patchstack | 20 May 2025
  • CVE ID: CVE-2025-48129
  • CVSS Score: 9.8 (Critical)
  • Patch Priority: ğŸ”´ High

ğŸ”¥ Risk

Unauthenticated attackers can escalate privileges by creating an Administrator-level account without needing any prior access. This allows complete takeover of the WordPress site.

Classified under: OWASP A7 â€“ Identification and Authentication Failures

ğŸ§ª Exploit Script Overview

This Python script targets vulnerable versions of the plugin and registers a new WordPress Administrator using only an email and password (hashed via MD5).

â–¶ï¸ Example Usage

ğŸ“˜ Usage Help

âœ… Successful Output Example

âš ï¸ Important Note

In some cases, logging in directly with the chosen password may fail.
This is not a bug in the exploit, but a result of how the vulnerable plugin passes hashed passwords to WordPressâ€™s internal user creation system.

If youâ€™re unable to log in, simply reset the password via email using the following URL:

WordPress will send a password reset email to the Admin account you just created â€” granting you full access.

ğŸ§¾ Legal Disclaimer

This tool is provided for educational and authorized penetration testing purposes only.
The author assumes no responsibility for misuse or damage caused by this script.

By: Nxploited ( Khaled_alenazi )
